title: Klopp To Make Liverpool Youth Key To Success
text:
Klopp To Make Liverpool Youth Key To Success 11:17,   Share by email Jurgen Klopp will scour Liverpool's youth ranks for potential Robert Lewandowskis as he plots an era of Anfield glory. 
The German broke Bayern Munich's Bundesliga monopoly by leading Borussia Dortmund to back-to-back titles, but he took more pride in helping turn Â£3m signing Lewandowski into one of the world's top strikers. 
And further development of Liverpool's youngsters - some already blooded by predecessor Brendan Rodgers - will form the basis of Klopp's blueprint for success. 
"The young guns are very interesting," said the new manager, who watched the club's U18 side beat Stoke on Saturday. "When I manage a club each young player should smile because their chance is bigger than it ever was. 
"The door is pretty wide open and I don't care so much about experience. Of course experience is an important point, but not the most important for me." 
Lewandowski, linked with a move to Liverpool in several Sunday newspapers, did not come through the Dortmund youth ranks but was little-known outside Poland when he joined from Lech Poznan. 
Klopp said: "The biggest satisfaction you can get is when you take a player from Poland, from a small club, and watch him playing today. 
"The difference between that player and the player he is today is unbelievable. I'm not self-confident enough to think I have had the only role in his development, but of course I did play a big part. 
"We all know the best players of today. Tomorrow we don't know, so we can work for this." 
That work could take a while though, according to Klopp, who has warned expectant Liverpool fans not to expect miracles. 
"I am not Jesus," he said. "If some people make me out to be like Jesus, then the next day they will say 'OK, he's not able to walk on water'. Then there is a problem. 
"For so many years Liverpool fans have been waiting and I understand they lose patience, but it doesn't work like that. We cannot change the whole world in one day." Promoted Stories
